noun.description: A low story between two others in a building, typically between the ground and first floors.

adjective.description: Relating to or denoting unsecured, higher-yielding loans that are subordinate to bank loans and secured loans but rank above equity.
examples: the company received $9.1 m in mezzanine financing

origin: Early 18th century: from French, from Italian mezzanino, diminutive of mezzano middle, from Latin medianus median.
